headline: Is Trade Desk (TTD) Now An Opportunity After A 65% One Year Share Price Slide?
summary: If you are wondering whether Trade Desk is now a bargain or still looks expensive, the key is to separate the recent share price slide from the company’s underlying value. The stock last closed at US$25.16, with returns of a 1.3% decline over 7 days, a 25.6% decline over 30 days, a 33.2% decline year to date, a 65.3% decline over 1 year, a 54.6% decline over 3 years, and a 63.8% decline over 5 years. These moves sit against a backdrop of ongoing interest in digital advertising and...

headline: Trade Desk’s Ventura CTV Ecosystem Aims To Reshape Streaming Ad Value
summary: The Trade Desk (NasdaqGM:TTD) has launched the Ventura Ecosystem for connected TV advertising. The new framework aims to create a more transparent, revenue focused marketplace for streaming platforms and advertisers. Early collaborators include V, formerly VIDAA TV OS, and Nexxen, with plans for additional partners. Ventura introduces tools for advanced monetization and measurement across connected TV inventory. The Trade Desk operates a demand side advertising platform, with a growing...

headline: Assessing Trade Desk (TTD) Valuation After Steep Share Price Pullback And Kokai Platform Rollout
summary: Recent share performance and size of the business Trade Desk (TTD) has drawn fresh attention after a sharp pullback, with the share price down about 26% over the past month and roughly 36% over the past 3 months. At a recent close of US$25.16, the company sits against a backdrop of a trailing 1-year total return near a 65% decline and a 5-year total return near a 64% decline, which some investors may compare with current fundamentals. headline: Trade Desk Stock Falls After Downgrade. Why the Slump Is Getting Even Worse.
summary: Trade Desk  stock was falling early Thursday, extending its terrible run, after its revenue outlook disappointed.  The company has faced a revenue growth slowdown and intense competition from the likes of  Amazon.com  and  Alphabet  ‘s Google.  In the earnings call, CEO Jeff Green said there had been “a sustained weakness among some large consumer packaged goods companies as well as some global auto companies.”

In the earnings call, CEO Jeff Green said there had been “a sustained weakness among some large consumer packaged goods companies as well as some global auto companies.”

headline: Victory Capital makes bid for Janus Henderson, Stellantis posts annual loss
summary: Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Victory Capital Holdings (VCTR) making a competing bid with Trian Fund Management to acquire Janus Henderson Group (JHG), shares of The Trade Desk (TTD) falling over its weak guidance, and US automaker Stellantis (STLA) posting its first-ever annual loss. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Trade Desk falls on weak outlook, Loop downgrades on ad recovery uncertainity
summary: Investing.com -- The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) drew a downgrade from Loop Capital after issuing a first quarter revenue forecast that missed expectations, raising fresh concerns about near term advertising demand. The shares fell about 16% in after hours trading, returning to pre COVID levels.

headline: Why The Trade Desk (TTD) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of digital advertising platform The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) fell 4.2% in the afternoon session after the company reported fourth-quarter results that beat expectations but issued a disappointing financial outlook for the first quarter of 2026.
